title: Front Wheel - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Do not allow a brake component to hang unsupported on the brake hose or line.
Brake hoses or lines that are not supported may become damaged or bent.
Bent or damaged brake hoses or lines lead to reduced braking efficiency that may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Raise and Support the Front of the Motorcycle
Raise and support the front of the motorcycle.
Detach Front Calipers - Front Brake Pads - Removal DR5 DS5

Loosen the lower pinch bolts at the lower end of the right hand fork.
Working from the right hand side, release and remove the wheel spindle which is threaded into the left hand fork.

body.name: Front Wheel Spindle Pinch bolts DR5 (IASM_00722)

body.body: Remove the wheel, recovering the spacers from both sides.
Place the wheel on suitable blocks to prevent damage to the brake discs.
Thoroughly clean all components and inspect for wear or damage.
